segments.title: Definition of Density
segments.summary: Density is explained as the ratio of mass to volume, measuring how packed something is. The standard unit is kg/m³, with water having a density of 1000 kg/m³ or 1 g/cm³.

segments.title: Air Density Variation
segments.summary: Explains how air density varies with altitude, from 0.1 g/cm³ at surface to 0.004 g/cm³ at 10km altitude. This variation occurs due to the weight of atmosphere compressing lower layers.

segments.title: Density and Floating
segments.summary: Demonstrates how objects with lower density float while those with higher density sink. Examples include oil floating on water and iron sinking in water.

segments.title: Water Density Temperature Relationship
segments.summary: Explains how water's density changes with temperature, reaching maximum density at 4°C. Below 4°C, density decreases as water molecules form gaps, leading to ice floating.

segments.title: Earth's Core Density Formation
segments.summary: Describes how Earth's structure formed based on density differences, with heavier metals sinking to form the core while lighter silicates floated to form the crust.
